header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Planning the day visits to Open Farm Sunday, Booking European rail train, Crossing Paris, Planting out tomato plants, Planning the following day, Library charges and paying fines, Issues with ‘down sizing’ and placement of specialist items, Recycling electrical equipment
header.activity: Planning the next couple of days
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, complaining, anecdote telling, making arrangements

body.u: so I think we need to have a quick discussion about erm planning for both today and the next few days
yes what do you think you are going to do today?

well I'm I'm quite keen to go on this open farm day erm and er and er was it ? it's about an hour away erm there is another farm about four miles away from the big tomato growing place it's open at four o'clock so I might go they open at ten eleven o'clock it closes at four o'clock
mm oh okay I thought four was a bit late to start I thought they might be doing cows or something different with that
erm well no no this is just tomatoes tomatoes this place you know it's a huge
the tomato place is ten to four

yeah and the main farms ar open at eleven no eleven to four and the main farm from eleven to five so there is another one an arable farm about four miles to go if we wanted to go to that now how does that hang with you?
mm well I'd like to come but
I knew there would be a but in there
well I would like to come very much I mean I've always wanted to get into and I think it's broadly similar
oh yeah

but if I do that I'm putting myself under a heck of a lot of pressure and you might be able to do it but I'm not sure how much turn of speed I know I've got more energy than I've had but I just don't know if I can do it and I'm sorry not to come to keep you company and I'm sorry for me because I'm missing out on something I want to do and I thought yesterday was a bit of a bummer of a day I managed to get some things done in the end but I couldn't really energise myself and having not slept very well last night I'm a bit concerned I might flake out when I get back
right okay
how do you feel about going on your own?
well that's alright what I might do is I'm fairly certain she's not interested in going I might ring up because she's the great horticulturist so
she was a bit dismissive about going to a farm wasn't she?

she was yes yes so that might I I'll give her the option the other thing I've got to do today erm I've got to do this erm chasing of all these people on the Heidelberg trip but I'm gonna ring the guy who is normally the organiser and erm see if he's got the contact details for this rather mysterious Italian lady that's came with us the one where all my emails are bouncing because I'm obviously I'm not spelling her name right but if I do that I can send her the email but then this evening I'm gonna ring them all and see if they are interested and I might get a bit sna snappy because

oh yes well it would be useful if they know if they want to or not I mean you are not saying they have to you just want to know don't you? I mean there's not there's not a wrong decision there's not a wrong answer it's just not having a decision is awkward
yeah that's right yes as far a yeah
have you given up on your group discounts?

yeah I do I contacted European rail and the group discount was not a you can't save any money you marginally save something on Eurostar but nothing on German railways in fact I've got a cheaper fare on German railways going by a different route than they seem to be get be able to get
oh okay so what way do you think you're going now?
well this will be down to London Eurostar to Paris across Paris well cross it's only a few hundred yards
oh which stations?
you come into Paris Nord and go out of Paris Est and they are only a few hundred yards apart apparently according to our sources

Nord nord oh because the first time I went to Paris I had never well I had mastered the London Underground but I thought oh I don't know if I could manage doing it so I got a map because I I understand maps and roads even if I don't understand metros
well I've got maps of Paris
and I w I and my then boyfriend walked across and I suppose we had luggage but whichever one we went to I think we went to is there a ?
yeah
because we were going down to which is in the south it's in the middle
but fine yeah
and it seemed quite a long walk but I mean it was a doable walk because I had
no thethese people reckon it's literally three or four hundred yards
are you thinking of a wheelie case?

oh yeah I'll be taking a wheelie case eveeven if it's only the small one but erm but the the the issue about that is there's a formal reception I will have to take at least one set of smart clothes you know
mm
erm so that's that's sort of today what are you doing tomorrow?
tomorrow well that rather depen everything I haven't done today basically
erm what I think I might do today you're promising me sunshine aren't you?
well that's what the weather forecast yesterday says I'll check it in a few minutes
it's quite early yet it might it might erm
yeah it said by the middle of the day it was going to be twenty-two degrees
well it was pretty warm by yesterday evening I mean warm for an evening
but brilliant sun as well the sky is still quite grey
yeah erm if I can I want to finish a bit of admin here which I just won't do for very long and I thought between about ten and two I might try and go to
uhu
including travelling
right I'm

and then come back and do some more admin and if I can do any paperwork tidying up all to the good with a view to doing my washing in the late afternoon so to be out of your washing arena and then tomorrow set aside the whole day with thinking through what I need to take where and any extra time I get I can go I can continue filling up that recycling box I'm not short of things to do but I fear there may not be other time and I may have to pause that activity that's oh erm I might like to go to the the library as well tomorrow my only thoughts on the library tomorrow is that one of my books on its third renewal is erm due back on the twenty-first so something has to happen and what I thought I might do is if I can take the book in check it in and then if no one wants it I'll check it out again if if I don't manage to do that are you au fait with that technique?
mm right check it out again yeah okay oh yeah oh just

I'll tell you the other thing that's really important that might take a bit of time is I ought to write to hospital about my pain clinic appointments but I've got to get my head in the right space to do that because I don't want to become across as erm Ms angry of

mm right on Monday I'm I've got the poe I'm run I'm doing poetry so that will be finished at that'll be finished at half eleven so what I could do is come from there then come to if that's useful? right it'll have to be it'll be indirect because I'll have to come via the park and ride because I'm going in on the park and ride but that's possible
mm well er the only thing I could mention is depending on what the weather is like a you don't want it too hot but you don't want it torrential storms you've got those tomatoes
tomatoes to put in yeah I don't want to leave them particularly in the car all the morning while I'm at poetry so you could if I packaged them you could take them in yeah?
what? only if I go over on Monday

yeah yeah if you don't go on Monday I will come back here pick them up and take them over because I need to get shot of them effectively because they'll need one or two days of TLC while they are over there to bed in with lots of slug pellets
yes I'm afraid there's lots of
knowing your knowing your population of snails
if you ever need them when they are over there do you know where to find them?
have you got some over there?
yes
oh I didn't know you had

erm if you go into my utility room and look on the shelves there's erm it's like an ice not an ice cream container erm the one that has the pow cleaning powder in it it's got a label on that says slug pellets but just to give you an idea of what shape and it's if you stand up it's about there
yeah mm oh right so just above head height
yeah
right
I think it's on the shelf above where I keep the keys
right Tuesday erm when have I got to get you to the station?
yeah erm we wrote in the diary the other day nine forty
leaving here at nine forty right okay

because because earlier is better for you because then you you you need to drop me off and I had a little thought about that actually because erm we can go to the disabled car park and put use my blue badge and then you could walk me we could or we could
well that's that's not a problem mm ah but you might need your blue badge in
yes and th then could you drive round if I wait outside the station could you drive round and drop off the
badge yeah that's possible

otherwise I did check the front of the station and there are some dropping-off spaces we could try for one of those but as a fall back option possibly do that oh you know we were talking about libraries?
yeah yeah I know where they are yeah yeah I'm not under so much pressure from that don't forget because the venue has been of the exam has been moved to rather than being in
oh right oh well you could drop me off at twenty past one then couldn't you?
I could do yeah it's not a problem
erm I think you might want some lunch so that's what we tried to fact factor in
oh that's not a problem I can dance around that whatever
oh you could go to the erm sandwich shop for old times' sake
yeah I don't think that one's open anymore is it?
I don't know
I think I think the blue one is open but the old one is not open I don't think

erm if you go to tomorrow I'd like you to register my new prescription card at the chemist because if I go to with my prescription he I mean they they know of me they know of me and they just say don't worry about it but they are a bit funny in well they're a bit more particular I mean they are probably more correct because they've got this electronic system and things but I mean that Mr is very nice
mm yeah that's not a problem yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah well I've I've got plenty of time on Monday afternoon in principle

yeah and that would enable me to have the card registered there erm in case because it's always useful I don't know what they'd s you you don't want to be there and them say go away you haven't got your card I don't know they would but
mm mm mm you are avoiding the possibility of that

the thing I wanted to tell you that came through on my library news which I think is a bit shocking erm because I always say how great our library service is one of the features I very much like has gone free res reservations
oh are they going to start charging?
a quid
yeah that's what they used to charge years ago

yes erm but I thought the free reservations were the pay-off for not giving us a choice of very much choice of library books and they said in order to maintain services we have to charge you a pound it wasn't just targeted at me saying because you have been overusing the service erm you can have fir I mean I I think it would be very encouraging to say you can you can have your first fifty a year free or I don't know how many books should you read in a year?
mm mm ten for the price of five yeah and that's too difficult programming into the system
well I don't know but trying to collect pounds off everybody when you do things online it presumably isn't simple

well no it just goes onto your account the same as your erm overdue charges doesn't it? if a book goes overdue you can log it in and it says you owe them money but you don't have to pay it then you can carry on taking books in and out but at some stage it starts blocking you and says give us the money and I'm sure that's how it will work because it's just an extension of that system then isn't it?
right mm
and I'm sure that's the system they used to use
sometimes they don't make you pay the the fine immediately do they?
no well that's your choice you can either pay immediately or defer it

yeah because erm I years and years ago when libraries were much friendlier places I took these library books back for erm er our person who was working as a caretaker you know we used to have students in and erm and I didn't and I forgot to take them I took them in I got them said I would drop them in and I didn't for a couple of days and they went overdue and there were some fines to pay on them and er they said oh you don't have to pay if it's not your book if you are just returning them but as this guy had gone off to work in erm where his country he came from or his mother came from erm Finland I think because er I thought it was a bit mean to leave him with a fine as I had enca I'd engendered the fine
mm it was your fault

yeah but they seemed to think it was quite erm very good of me to pay the fine but if know if you say you are going to take a book it seemed a bit mean not and he didn't come back to the country for a while but he did come back because he did his PGCE in he liked it up there because erm erm he liked it up because er he was a mountaineer and he had more things to climb
yes mm in ?
well you can go out to all the
well I suppose you can go out to the Peak District
I mean how far away is the and people are always shinning up that I mean what have you got here? the climbing wall at

that's true well there's not much climbing there is there unless you do horizontal climbing yeah mm mm mm so do you know what what you've got in mind erm to do when you are at your sister's? are you still gonna be clearing out junk?

who knows? well I don't know I mean the trouble is I I fear y you know what I'm doing at the moment with paperwork if it's junk it's quite easy to dispose of if it's old broke and tatty it's when it's pretty good but not wanted replacement er not you know not replacement what the word is you know new rehoming rehoming is a more difficult scheme
mm yeah it takes a lot more effort I think you can
for example these big speakers especially when they are things that take two people to move
mm well don't forget you could always contact if you would have to find the right one I know how to do it in the Red Cross for instance so phone them up and tell them you've got them they might well

oh I've got I've got a list of phone numbers of contacts for like furniture but specialist equipment that is used that is heavy bulky and only used in certain situations probably by a particular sort of person I'm going to see how feels but erm I might well email because her husband erm partner husband I think erm he I don't he may have retired completely now but he used to have quite a good living being a bit retro going around to popstars and people of the older generation who still had recording equipment that you couldn't you know he could mend it and do some of that so I don't know it's the right sort of era
yeah analogue equipment yeah yeah well that's that's a good source and the right sort of thing as well yeah but

yeah not quite not quite I mean I don't think they'll be playing but I mean h he I think I I spoke to somebody and oh I think it might be actually and because she didn't have a contact but I have now got a contact another thing you have to send birthday card today she said if saw an email for that she probably wouldn't pass it on because she's having a heck of a job trying to get wean him down because he's got really quite a big jukebox in the living room you know he's that sort of person and he erm he was going to get rid of his great big carp which are well most of the garden was a con a c a sort of shed thing to keep his carp in at I suppose at night time I don't know perhaps they stay in all day but you know big carps they need a lot of space to swim around

oh right yeah yeah oh yeah mm the remember the Red Cross is one of the few places that will take electrical equipment a lot of places won't because if they take it if they are gonna resell it they have to test it which means quite a lot of extra work that's why a lot of the charity shops won't take electrical equipment but you know the big Red Cross shop in has got a lot of electrical equipment televisions video recorders and things like that
oh right I don't know mm mm mm also if you need to recycle stuff electrical stuff I I assumed you could take it to
oh yeah you could take it there

but it says in the erm WhatsOn in somewhere well one of these things we get news things possibly the library thing but it's a bit out of their sort of thing for them that they are doing y you can there's a date in July you can take it to park and ride and there's all over the all over the pl all over the county
oh is is this specific for electrical equipment?
yeah
oh right okay you know it's not that charity again is it?
no no they well I don't think it is
they got their fingers burnt because they ended up with so much stuff

no no they they just didn't they they used to come round because they used to give the parish council some money for doing it they used to advertise they used to collect it take it away but they said the price of scrap has gone down to such a rate that it's just not viable they didn't say response is overwhelming because everybody found they had a garage full of rubbish
money yeah mm electrical rubbish they wanted to get rid of
but also when that happened they apparently allegedly didn't get everything they should do because somebody else came round in a white van and
helped themselves
yes
yeah yeah
erm but I mean at the moment the the way they're writing like you know you'd have to pay these people in white vans to take it away any way you look as though you need to hurry off now
mm yes
okay erm what time? do you think you'll what's the earliest you might go out so we can liaise as necessary?
about eleven o'clock I think
oh okay so er that's a little while yet isn't it?
yeah I've got to make these phone calls first to see if I can set up these contacts
right catch up with you later then
right
